page.title: 17TEACHERS' PAY DISPUTE
page.content: Currently there is an industrial dispute between many of the teachers who live in the village and surrounding areas and the Education Authority. After a similar dispute in 1974 teachers' salaries were increased to be comparable with similar salaries in the private sector.Since that time the real value of teachers'salaries has declined as inflation has had its effects. The shortfall now is about 34%. Teachers have been on strike on a number of days this year in an attempt to improve a pay offer of 4%, with an inflation rate this year of about 7%. At the time of writing this dispute is unresolved. Matters are not helped by the effect of the Conservative Government's legislation which enables it to control the amount spent by Local Authorities on school education.
